description: Provides insight into the usage of the various resource pools

panels.description: The preferred number of queries that execute concurrently in this resource pool.
panels.title: Planned Concurrency

panels.description: The maximum number of concurrent execution slots that a resource pool can have. When it is equal to Unlimited, it means the resource pool can have unlimited number of concurrent execution slots. When it is equal to 0, it means queries are prevented from running in the pool.
panels.title: Maximum Concurrency

panels.description: Value assigned as the maximum size (in MegaBytes) this resource pool can grow by borrowing memory from the GENERAL pool.
panels.title: Maximum Memory (MB)

panels.description: The maximum amount of memory allocated by this pool to process any query. Value, in MegaBytes, of the MAXQUERYMEMORYSIZE parameter as defined for the pool. When it is equal to Unlimited, it means resource pool can borrow any amount of available memory from the GENERAL pool, within the limits reported by Maximum Memory panel.
panels.title: Maximum Query Memory (MB)

panels.description: Specifies priority of queries in this pool when they compete for resources in the GENERAL pool.
panels.title: Priority

panels.description: Limits in seconds how soon a query must finish before the Resource Manager assigns to it the resource pool's RUNTIMEPRIORITY setting.
panels.title: Runtime Priority Threshold

panels.description: The maximum length of time requests can wait for resources to become available before being rejected
panels.title: Queue Timeout
Current Pool Usage Activity (in average per node) for $pool_name pool

panels.description: The average number of queries per node currently executing in the pool.
panels.title: Average Running Query Count

panels.description: The average amount of borrowed memory, per node, from the GENERAL pool by requests running against the pool.
panels.title: Avg. General Memory

panels.description: The average amount of memory per node,  for all queued requests in the pool.
panels.title: Avg.  Memory for Queued Requests

panels.description: When the amount of memory (in MegaBytes) used by all requests against this resource pool exceeds this, new requests against the pool are queued until memory becomes available.
panels.title: Queueing Threshold (MB)

panels.description: Percentage of memory used in a pool.
panels.title: Memory Used %

panels.description: The current amount of memory (in MegaBytes) that queries are tuned to use in the pool.
panels.title: Avg. Query Budget (MB)
Resource Pool Statistics (in average per node) for $pool_name pool

panels.description: This shows how the Max Memory, Pool Memory and Free Memory in the pool change over time. Each of the values is an average per node.
panels.title: Resource Usage (MB)

panels.description:
The time it takes in average for the execution of a single query. 
 Each point represents the average execution per query  over the past 5 min.
panels.title: Average Execution

panels.description: Shows  how fast  resource rejections count increases per second.
panels.title: Resource Rejections

panels.description: The average number of running queries over time.
panels.title: Average Number of Running Queries

panels.description: This table is a summary of resource usage for all nodes. With this you can get information about Pool Size, Max Memory... for each node. It is a complement to other panels that give averages per node. It captures just the last values.
panels.title: Resource Uage Details by all Nodes

panels.description: This table is a summary of resource rejection for all nodes. With this you can get the resource rejection count for each node. It captures just the last values for each node.
panels.title: Resource Rejection Details

panels.description: Given a selected node, it displays the disk storage in total for each storage usage.
panels.title: Total Disk Storage

panels.description: Given a selected node, it displays the current disk storage usage for each storage usage.
panels.title: Disk Storage Used

panels.description: Given a selected node, it displays the percentage of current disk storage available for each storage usage.
panels.title: Disk Storage Available

panels.description: Measures each storage location's performance in MB/s.
panels.title: Throughput in MB/sec

panels.description: Measures each storage location's performance in seeks/s.
panels.title: Latency in seeks/sec

panels.description: The percentage of disk space used for each storage usage, over time.
panels.title: Disk Space Used Percentage

title: Vertica / EON / Resource Management
